subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Is there any reason to use the official JUnit distribution for its testcase runner(s) vs just its TestCase interface? I hear all serious people have their
messageBody:
--- Bill_de_hï¿½ra <dehora@...> wrote:
> No, it means there's no apparent way to get them
> committed. Scott
> Sterling has been sitting on a classloader fix for
> heaven knows how
> long. Calling working around the fact that Junit is
> inactive
> "contributions" to Junit is quite bizarre.
>

Is there any reason to use the official JUnit
distribution for its testcase runner(s) vs just its
TestCase interface? I hear all serious people have
their own runners anyway.

Failing that, has anyone attempted to perform a
hostile takeover of junit project at sourceforge?
